intro: Amsinckia leucosperma, commonly known as the white thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy stems. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a fuzzy texture, while the stems are erect and branching. Amsinckia leucosperma is adapted to dry, rocky environments and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
